1.text: Better is the poor that walketh in his integrity Than he that is perverse in his lips and a fool at the same time.

2.text: Also, that the soul be without knowledge is not good; And he that hasteth with his feet sinneth.

3.text: The foolishness of man perverteth his way; And his heart fretteth against the LORD.

4.text: Wealth addeth many friends; But as for the poor, his friend separateth himself from him.

5.text: A false witness shall not be unpunished; And he that breatheth forth lies shall not escape.

6.text: Many will entreat the favour of the liberal man; And every man is a friend to him that giveth gifts.

7.text: All the brethren of the poor do hate him; How much more do his friends go far from him! He that pursueth words, they turn against him.

8.text: He that getteth wisdom loveth his own soul; He that keepeth understanding shall find good.

9.text: A false witness shall not be unpunished; And he that breatheth forth lies shall perish.

10.text: Luxury is not seemly for a fool; Much less for a servant to have rule over princes.

11.text: It is the discretion of a man to be slow to anger, And it is his glory to pass over a transgression.

12.text: The king’s wrath is as the roaring of a lion; But his favour is as dew upon the grass.

13.text: A foolish son is the calamity of his father; And the contentions of a wife are a continual dropping.

14.text: House and riches are the inheritance of fathers; But a prudent wife is from the LORD.

15.text: Slothfulness casteth into a deep sleep; And the idle soul shall suffer hunger.

16.text: He that keepeth the commandment keepeth his soul; But he that despiseth His ways shall die.

17.text: He that is gracious unto the poor lendeth unto the LORD; And his good deed will He repay unto him.

18.text: Chasten thy son, for there is hope; But set not thy heart on his destruction.

19.text: A man of great wrath shall suffer punishment; For if thou interpose, thou wilt add thereto.

20.text: Hear counsel, and receive instruction, That thou mayest be wise in thy latter end.

21.text: There are many devices in a man’s heart; But the counsel of the LORD, that shall stand.

22.text: The lust of a man is his shame; And a poor man is better than a liar.

23.text: The fear of the LORD tendeth to life; And he that hath it shall abide satisfied, He shall not be visited with evil.

24.text: The sluggard burieth his hand in the dish, And will not so much as bring it back to his mouth.

25.text: When thou smitest a scorner, the simple will become prudent; And when one that hath understanding is reproved, he will understand knowledge.

26.text: A son that dealeth shamefully and reproachfully Will despoil his father, and chase away his mother.

27.text: Cease, my son, to hear the instruction That causeth to err from the words of knowledge.

28.text: An ungodly witness mocketh at right; And the mouth of the wicked devoureth iniquity.

29.text: Judgments are prepared for scorners, And stripes for the back of fools.
